name: Rosco Gordon
description: '''Rosco N. Gordon III''' (April 10, 1928 â€“ July 11, 2002), sometimes billed as '''Roscoe Gordon''', was an American [[blues]] singer, pianist, and songwriter. He is best known for his hit songs "Booted," (1952), "[[No More Doggin']]" (1952), and "[[Just a Little Bit (Rosco Gordon song)|Just a Little Bit]]" (1960). Gordon was a pioneer of the [[Memphis blues]] style. He played piano in a style known as the "Rosco rhythm," with the emphasis on the [[off-beat (music)|off-beat]]. This rhythm was an influence on later musical styles such as Jamaican [[ska]] and [[reggae]].
